Episodes.description: A gypsy puts a curse on Homer in "Hex In The City." Then, The Simpsons' new automated house malfunctions and tries to kill Homer. Finally, Bart and Lisa attend a school for wizards in "Wiz Kids."
Episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XII

Episodes.description: After Bart takes a joyride in a police car, a judge orders him to be tethered to Homer at all times.
Episodes.title: The Parent Rap

Episodes.description: Homer and his friends are forced to drink in the Simpsons' garage after Moe the Bartender renovates his shady bar into a hipster hangout.
Episodes.title: Homer the Moe

Episodes.description: Mr. Burns falls in love with a younger woman and recruits Homer to help him impress her.
Episodes.title: A Hunka Hunka Burns in Love

Episodes.description: A hypnotist uncovers a traumatic experience from Homer's childhood.
Episodes.title: The Blunder Years

Episodes.description: Feeling her church cares more about making money then helping people, Lisa drops Christianity for Buddhism.
Episodes.title: She of Little Faith

Episodes.description: A social services officer brings unity to the Simpson family, but their newfound happiness is threatened when the cocktail waitress Homer married in Vegas shows up at their door.
Episodes.title: Brawl in the Family

Episodes.description: Marge rallies for a ban on sugar after Springfield is declared America's fattest city.
Episodes.title: Sweets and Sour Marge

Episodes.description: Marge can't deal with the quiet after Homer has his jaws wired shut.
Episodes.title: Jaws Wired Shut

Episodes.description: Marge's high school sweetheart Artie Ziff returns and offers Homer a million dollars to spend a weekend with Marge.
Episodes.title: Half-Decent Proposal

Episodes.description: Bart breaks up with his new girlfriend Greta, but gets jealous when she begins dating Milhouse.
Episodes.title: The Bart Wants What It Wants

Episodes.description: Bart meets a retired cowboy movie star and convinces him to make a comeback on The Krusty the Clown Show.
Episodes.title: The Lastest Gun in the West

Episodes.description: Abe gets his driver's license back to impress a new woman at the retirement home.
Episodes.title: The Old Man and the Key

Episodes.description: The family reads stories from a long overdue library book. First, Homer (Odysseus) struggles to find his way home after the Trojan War. Next, Lisa (Joan Of Arc) leads the French army after hearing the voice of God. Finally, Bart (Hamlet) avenges the murder of his father.
Episodes.title: Tales from the Public Domain

Episodes.description: Lisa sponsors an orphan in Brazil, and when he goes missing she convinces the family to go to Brazil to find him. While there, Homer is kidnapped.
Episodes.title: Blame It on Lisa

Episodes.description: After a traumatizing eye injury, Homer becomes a habitual user of medical marijuana.
Episodes.title: Weekend at Burnsie's

Episodes.description: In this clip show, the citizens of Springfield honor Homer Simpsons with a Roast, but the festivities take a turn for the worst when aliens crash it.
Episodes.title: Gump Roast

Episodes.description: Bart's comic about Homer becomes a hit on-line, prompting Homer to attempt to control his anger.
Episodes.title: I Am Furious Yellow

Episodes.description: Apu's marriage is on the rocks after Manjula finds out he cheated on her.
Episodes.title: The Sweetest Apu

Episodes.description: Lisa pretends to be a college student and loses favor with her classmates at Springfield Elementary in the process. A mysterious illness forces Bart to live in a plastic bubble.
Episodes.title: Little Girl in the Big Ten

Episodes.description: Homer and Marge find themselves on death row after they are framed for murder.
Episodes.title: The Frying Game

Episodes.description: Homer becomes chief of police after a scandal forces Wiggum out.
Episodes.title: Poppa's Got a Brand New Badge
